snippet.title: Qld exports will continue growing: Premier
snippet.content: Queensland exports won't be jeopardised by the state government's plan to preference local companies for goods and services contracts, Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk says. After Ms Palaszczuk announced local businesses were poised to receive weightings of up to 30 per cent in consideration of government contracts at last weekend's state Labor conference, Federal Trade Minister Steve Ciobo labelled the move "reckless" and potentially damaging to international trade. However Ms Palaszczuk told AAP 80 per cent of all extra export dollars earned since 2015 have come from Queensland and "getting advice from Mr Ciobo about growing trade would be like Laurie Daley telling Kevvie Walters how to win State of Origin." (C) AAP 2017
